alert.note: Alert for Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 8:48AM EDT until May 01 at 8:37AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Patrick. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated along the Smith River near Woolwine and along the South Mayo River near Nettleridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain overnight. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain had fallen. Even though the rain has ended, some small streams and creeks were still rising. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ararat River, Archies Creek, Bull Mountain Fork, Burks Fork, Anglin Branch, Dan River, Birds Branch, Crooked Creek and Blackberry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stuart... Woolwine... Ararat... Buffalo Ridge... Patrick Springs... Rocky Knob Recreation Area... Critz... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
